properties.Name: RelatedLedger
properties.Description:
The relationship between two or more Ledgers.

In the case of a subledger the Ledger Account Number represents the account to which the related ledger is a subledger for. i.e.. The total of all account balances for the subledger should equal the balance of the Ledger Account Number.

For example:
General Ledger Account 3100 - Accounts Receivable has a balance of $50,000
The Subledger associated with this account is the Accounts Receivable Ledger and it has 250 ledger accounts. The total of all 250 ledger accounts should equal $50,000.

Columns.Name: LedgerId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Ledger.

Columns.Name: RelatedLedgerId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Ledger.

Columns.Name: LedgerRelationshipTypeId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Ledger Relationship Type.

Columns.Name: LedgerRelationshipNote
Columns.Description: A note, comment or additional information regarding the ledger relationship.

Columns.Name: LedgerAccountNumber
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Ledger Account.

Properties.Description:
The relationship between two or more Ledgers.

In the case of a subledger the Ledger Account Number represents the account to which the related ledger is a subledger for. i.e.. The total of all account balances for the subledger should equal the balance of the Ledger Account Number.

For example:
General Ledger Account 3100 - Accounts Receivable has a balance of $50,000
The Subledger associated with this account is the Accounts Receivable Ledger and it has 250 ledger accounts. The total of all 250 ledger accounts should equal $50,000.
